quotes.quote: People got insights into what was bothering them, but they hardly did a damn thing to change.
When you can't change what's bothering you, one typical response is to convince yourself that it doesn't actually bother you.
Nothing in the world can bother you as much as your own mind, I tell you. In fact, others seem to be bothering you, but it is not others, it is your own mind.
You're not bothering me. I'm not doing anything. Well, I was breathing, and my heart was beating. But the rest of me wasn't busy.
But we didn't speak of what was bothering us the most. Maybe we didn't need to. It couldn't have been 'talked out.' It had to be worn out.
It is easy to answer the ultimate questions - it saves you bothering with the immediate ones.
People with opinions just go around bothering each other.
A lifetime can well be spent correcting and improving one's own faults without bothering about others.
The comfort zone takes our greatest aspirations and turns them into excuses for not bothering to aspire.
Women treat us, men, like humanity treats gods and they worship us and keep bothering us to do something.
I've never had any trouble opposing people I've been close to. I've never worried about offending or bothering people I feel strongly about.
It's just a crime that people don't take the time and make the effort to have a conversation if it's bothering them that much.
I want us to be together without bothering about ourselves- to be really together because we ARE together, as if it were a phenomenon, not a thing we have to maintain by our own effort.
So unless you really care about me as a person, stop bothering me. I'm done pretending, you should be too.
Shouldn't everything you do matter if you're bothering at all? Not to hold on when it's over, that's the trick.
I am successful because I did not waste time bothering about what others were doing but focussed on what I was doing.
People always come up to me and say that my smoking is bothering them... Well, it's killing me!
We give so little when it's in us always to give so much more. It's bothering to listen with an open heart to someone who smells bad. It's hard.
